job_description:
Job Title: HL7 FHIR Solutions Architect
Location: Downtown Toronto, Canada
Job Type: Permanent

Key Responsibilities
Design a Conformance Assessment strategy to gauge and confirm industry adherence to Canadian interoperability norms, under senior leadership's direction.
Based on previous connectivity event insights, pinpoint a Canadian technical delivery ally for the Gazelle testing platform.
Initiate the primary technical testing foundation to back the PS-CA standard.
Formulate vendor onboarding protocols and inaugurate an autonomous testing solution.
Lead a pilot evaluation for the Patient Summary standard.
Broaden the conformance program's application to additional elements of the pan-Canadian Interoperability Blueprint.

Prerequisites
Bachelor's degree in Computer/Software Engineering or analogous discipline.
Profound knowledge of pertinent Health IT standards.
Solid technical or solution architecture foundation.
Advanced software development, design, and product crafting abilities, especially in the realm of Health IT Standards (like HL7, IHE, etc.).
Familiarity with IHE profile concepts, IHE Connectathon, and technical testing activities.
Hands-on experience with system integrations (APIs, for instance), documentation, sandbox setups, and implementation blueprints.
At least 5 years in senior roles like Software Engineer or Architect.
A minimum of 5 years crafting Health IT Standards-focused software tools.
